abstract: The Justice Department said the Social Security Administration would apply the Supreme Court’s June ruling declaring marriage a constitutional right retroactively.
snippet: The Justice Department said the Social Security Administration would apply the Supreme Court’s June ruling declaring marriage a constitutional right retroactively.
lead_paragraph: Same-sex married couples who were living in states that did not recognize their unions and who previously filed claims for Social Security benefits will be able to collect those payments, the government said on Thursday.

headline.main: Gay Couples Are Eligible for Social Security Benefits, U.S. Decides
headline.print_headline: Gay Couples Are Eligible for Benefits, U.S. Decides

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Lambda Legal Defense and Education Fund
